dc:title: A People's Movement
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Describes the C.W. movement as one that gets at the roots of things in order to reorder society. Prayer, work and thought are essentials to this task. Discusses P. Maurin's effect on others and discourses on the concepts of hell, free will and sainthood.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 81 1947-02-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
